abstract: One way to untie the knotted American mortgage market might be to stiffen the rules on home loans.
snippet: One way to untie the knotted American mortgage market might be to stiffen the rules on home loans.
lead_paragraph: Fixing mortgage finance involves more than just Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac and the private home loan market. The Obama administration was right to finally put the bailed-out mortgage giants on center stage at a conference convened on Tuesday. But the crisis had a third leg: borrowers got ahead of themselves.
